III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Emergency restraint
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4160
Section (1) The use of emergency restraint as a lifesaving response
Description for a youth will be limited to:
(a) An emergency response to protect the youth or others
from an unanticipated or severely aggressive behavior that
places the youth or others at serious threat of violence or
injury if no immediate intervention occurs.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth A is assaulted often by other peers, and no one does
anything about it. Youth A was specifically assaulted by Youth B
and staff that were around failed to intervene. Staff failed to
restrain a youth harming another youth.
Investigation On 3/11/24, I spoke to DHHS Worker 1. Allegations and
scheduling were discussed. No additional information was
provided.
On 3/11/24, I left a voicemail for Complainant 1. Complainant 1
did not return the voicemail.
On 3/11/24 I left a voicemail for Foster Care Worker 1 (FCW 1).
Returned communication for FCW 1 was not received.
On 3/12/24 I spoke to Administrator 1. Administrator 1 reported
Youth A displays a lack of boundaries with other youth. Youth A
will initiate problems amongst his peers and then get upset when
his peers get upset at him. Youth A wants to socialize with others
but doesn’t have boundaries and doesn’t handle transitions well.
Administrator 1 reported they do have a safety plan in place for
Youth A that staff are aware of. He also has an upcoming
psychiatric evaluation scheduled for medication adjustments.
Specific allegations are for an incident on 3/7/24 at 11:41am. The
incident occurred in the dining room while the unit was eating
lunch.
The following interviews were conducted with DHHS Worker 1
at the facility on 3/18/24:
2

Clinical Director 1:
Clinical Director 1 reported he is aware of the incident in question.
He reported he watched the video and did not find any issues with
how his staff handled the situation. He reported staff were actively
engaged with the youth and they intervened. He reported Youth A
has been involved in multiple situations, usually back and forth
verbally with other youth. But would not state that Youth A is the
only one in the incidents. At times Youth A starts the verbal
aggression and at times other youth start it. Clinical Director 1
reported Youth A is not always involved in the issues in the unit.
Clinical Director 1 reported they have a treatment plan in place
that staff are aware of. Youth A has difficulties during transitions,
so they have staff near him during transitions. Clinical Director 1
reported he has never had anyone tell him that they felt Youth A
was unsafe.
Youth A
Youth A reported on 3/7/24 he was in the lunchroom and Youth B
attempted to fight him. Youth A reported the staff (unknown) that
were present stopped Youth B from hitting him. Youth A reported
at the facility there is a staff that stays with him all the time. Youth
A reported Staff 1 usually stays with him. Youth A reported he
likes Staff 1. Youth A reports other kids bully him, but when
questioned did not want to talk about it.
Youth B was unable to be interviewed at the time of the
interviews. Youth B was AWOL.
Staff 1
Staff 1 reported he was working on 3/7/24 during the incident.
Both Youth A and Youth B were throwing food back and forth at
each other. Staff 2 and himself intervened and redirected Youth A
to stop and move his seat. Youth A did not listen to the directive.
They continued to throw food back and forth although verbally
redirected. Youth A began to use profanity and Youth B then
stood up and attempted to go around the lunch table to fight Youth
A. Staff 1 reported Staff 2 went over to Youth B and talked to him
while he stayed with Youth A. Staff 1 reported the two youth were
never able to physical touch each other and not seen by the nurse
because there was never a fight. Staff 1 reported they have
discussed Youth A’s behaviors and treatment plan in team
meetings and came up with a 1:1 staffing plan. Staff 1 reported he
is the 1:1 staff on his shift because he has a good relationship with
Youth A. Staff 1 reported Youth A does create situations for
himself. Staff 1 reported he will say sexual comments to the other
youth and upset them. Staff 1 reported that in school Youth A is
3

unable to sit still for long periods of time, so they give him breaks
every 10-15 minutes. Youth A will take walks with him when he
needs space as well. Staff 1 reported he has never witnessed
anyone able to physically assault Youth A. Staff 1 reported the
staff verbally redirect and get in between the youth if they attempt
to fight.
Staff 2
Staff 2 reported he was working on 3/7/24 during the incident.
Staff 2 reported Youth A and Youth B were pushing a milk carton
back and forth on the table. Staff 2 reported he stood behind
Youth A and redirected them to stop. Youth A stood up and then
Youth B did. Staff 2 reported he intervened and stood between the
youth. Staff 1 was present, along with Youth A. Staff 2 reported
the youth never physically fought. Staff 2 reported Youth A is
cognitively low functioning and has a hard time socializing with the
other peers. Staff 2 reported he does not get targeted by other
youth but does place himself in situations where he and the other
youth want to fight. Staff 2 reported the treatment team is
attempting to help Youth A vocalize appropriately with other youth
by not cussing at them or yelling at them. Staff 2 reported they
have discussed Youth A in team meetings and have made some
changes with his line transitions. Staff 2 reported when Youth A is
in line there are two staff near him to help him transition well. In
school, he has a 1:1 staff that helps him throughout the day. Staff
2 reported he has never seen other youth allowed to fight Youth A
and has always seen staff intervene and redirect the other youth
as well as Youth A when needed.
Staff 3
Staff 3 reported she was working on 3/7/24 during the incident.
Staff 3 reported Youth A and Youth B were tossing food back and
forth towards each other at the lunchroom. Staff 3 reported a male
staff intervened (she could not remember who). Staff 3 reported
the male staff redirected the youth verbally and then when the
youth got up from the table they were separated. Staff 3 reported
the youth had never touched each other. Staff 3 reported Youth A
struggles to remove himself from situations on his own. Staff 3
reported Youth A makes sexual comments towards the other
youth in the unit which provokes many situations. He misses
social cues as well. Staff 3 reported they have discussed Youth A
in team meetings and have set up different interventions for him.
Staff are to be near him to help him process situations and to
protect himself and others from physical altercations. He also is
involved in the Pathways program for sex offenders with his
therapist.
4

Staff 4 was contacted via telephone on 3/18/24 and 4/11/24 and
return communication was not received.
Video Review:
I watched the video concerning the specific incident. The incident
in question occurred on 3/7/24 in the dining room. It started at
11:41:48am and ended at 11:44:42am. Youth A and Youth B were
sitting across from each other at the lunch table and began
tossing food items back and forth towards each other. Staff 1,
Staff 2, Staff 3, and Staff 4 were all present. Staff used proximity,
verbal redirection, and separation to deescalate the situation. All
staff intervened. Youth were not physical towards one another.
Documentation Review:
Youth A Safety Plan: The safety plan was created on 2/15/24.
Youth A has additional staff near him, availability of breaks from
the group and interventions to help with positive interactions with
peers. Once escalated, verbal redirection will occur, and he will be
removed from situations.
Youth A’s Intake: Youth A has been placed in the facility since
2/6/24.
Unusual Incident Report Summary: I reviewed the facilities
electronic case noting and incident reporting system, Carelogic.
Youth A has had 8 incidents from 2/6/24-3/7/24. Only one incident
report dated, 2/24/24 noted Youth A was antagonized by another
peer. All other reports noted Youth A as escalating the situation,
assaultive to other peers or not listening to staff directions.
• 2/24/24 incident: Youth A was being antagonized by
another peer, so Youth A slapped the other youth, the other
youth responded by punching Youth A. Staff separated
them.
Analysis There is no evidence to validate Youth A was assaulted often or
assaulted in this incident on 3/7/24. Interviews, video, and incident
reports support the agency is aware of Youth A’s needs and have
placed appropriate interventions in place. All staff were able to
verbalize those interventions and video demonstrated their
compliance to them. Youth A verbalized he was not assaulted on
3/7/24 and that a staff remains with him all the time. In this specific
incident, the staff did not need to intervene with a restraint, they
verbally deescalated, used proximity, and separated the youth
5

from each other. Allegations noting the staff allowed Youth B to
assault Youth A without intervening is unfounded.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code Behavior Management
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4157
Section (2) At a minimum the behavior management system shall
Description include all of the following: (b) positive interventions
strategies to assist residents in developing improved
problem solving, self-management, and social skills.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation The agency is not doing anything to prevent incidents from

Staff 2 reported when Youth A is in line there are two staff near

Staff 3 reported Youth A struggles to remove himself from

Staff 4 was contacted via telephone on 3/18/24 and 4/11/24 and
return communication was not received.
Documentation Review:
Youth A Safety Plan: The safety plan was created on 2/15/24.
Youth A has additional staff near him, availability of breaks from
the group, interventions to help with positive interactions with
7

peers. Once escalated, verbal redirection will occur, and he will be
removed from situations.
Youth A’s Intake: Youth A has been placed in the facility since
2/6/24.
Unusual Incident Report Summary: I reviewed the facilities
electronic case noting and incident reporting system, Carelogic.
Youth A has had 8 incidents from 2/6/24-3/7/24. Only one incident
report dated, 2/24/24 noted Youth A was antagonized by another
peer. All other reports noted Youth A as escalating the situation,

• 2/24/24 incident: Youth A was being antagonized by
another peer, so Youth A slapped the other youth, the other
youth responded by punching Youth A. Staff separated
them.
Team Meeting Minutes:
I reviewed the three Team Meeting Minutes for the month of
February. Interventions were outlined and treatment focused on
routine, structure, and inclusion.
Analysis Based on interviews with staff and Youth A, there are
interventions in place. Youth A was placed in the facility on 2/6/24
and by 2/11/24, a safety plan was created, and team meeting
minutes addressed the need for routine, structure, and inclusion.
All staff interviewed were able to describe the issues Youth A has
currently and what interventions they are to use for his safety as
well as others. A psychiatric evaluation is scheduled too.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
8

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.

sir_summary.summary: A special investigation was conducted into allegations that staff at Queen of Angels failed to intervene and restrain Youth B from assaulting Youth A, and that the agency was not doing enough to prevent incidents involving Youth A. The investigation, which included interviews, video review, and document analysis, found that staff appropriately used verbal de-escalation, proximity, and separation to manage a lunchroom incident on March 7, 2024, preventing physical contact. It also found that a safety plan and multiple interventions (1:1 staffing, transition support, treatment plans) were in place for Youth A. Culpability lies with the complainant, as the allegations were unfounded and the facility was found to be in compliance.
